clinical_study.brief_title: Construction and Application of Early Lung Rehabilitation Training Programs
clinical_study.official_title: Construction and Application of Early Lung Rehabilitation Training Programs for Adult Patients After Double Lung Transplantation

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: This study is intended to construct early lung rehabilitation training programs for adult patients after double lung transplantation, including safety assessment, exercise training, respiratory function training, psychological support and health education, with a view to helping double lung transplant patients achieve lung rehabilitation at an early date, improve patients' motor endurance and respiratory function, and improve the quality of near- and long-term survival.

detailed_description.textblock: The first stage constructs the lung rehabilitation program, and the second stage implements the non-contemporaneous study control trial.

arm_group.description: Review the collection of patient-related clinical data, collation of clinical data and outcome indicators
The intervention was implemented in accordance with the Early Lung Rehabilitation Training Programme for Adult Double Lung Transplant Patients

intervention.description: It is implemented in accordance with the Early Lung Rehabilitation Training Program for Adult Double Lung Transplant Patients. Establish multidisciplinary collaboration teams, including competent doctors, nurses, rehabilitation physicians, and psychologists.
Provide rehabilitation training as usual, without standard program
